257  public CommandThreadBase GetCommmandThread(int whichCommandThread)
258  {
259  lock (Lock)
260  {
261  if (whichCommandThread > CommandThreads.Count || whichCommandThread < 0)
262  throw new ArgumentException("Number of thread " + whichCommandThread + " is out of range, should be between 0 and "

315  public static CommandLineApplicationInterpreter Global
316  {

389  protected virtual bool IsVariableReference(CommandThread cmdThread, string str)
390  {
391  if (str != null)
392  if (str.Length > 1)
393  if (str[0] == _variableStart)
394  return true;
395  return false;
396  }
397 
404  protected virtual string SubstituteVariableOrExpressionReference(CommandThread cmdThread, string str)
405  {
406  if (str == null)
407  return str;
408  else if (str.Length < 2)
409  return str;
410  else
411  {
412  char firstChar = str[0];
413  if (firstChar == _variableStart)
414  return this.GetVariableValue(cmdThread, str.Substring(1, str.Length - 1));
415  else if (firstChar == _expressionStart)
416  return this.EvaluateJs(str.Substring(1, str.Length - 1));
417  else
418  return str;
419  }
420  }

434  public InterpreterVariable GetLocalVariable(CommandThread cmdThread, string varName, int framesBelowTop)
435  {
436 
437  int stackLevel = cmdThread.TopFrameIndex;
438 
439  throw new NotImplementedException();
440 
441 
442 
443 
444  if (cmdThread.TopFrameIndex < framesBelowTop)
445  throw new InvalidOperationException("The stack is less than " + framesBelowTop + " levels deep.");
446  InterpreterVariable ret = null;
447  int whichLevelBelow = 0;
448  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
449  while (whichLevelBelow <= framesBelowTop)
450  {
451  if (whichLevelBelow == framesBelowTop)
452  return frame.GetVariableDef(varName);
453  else
454  {
455  if (frame.StackLevel == 0)
456  throw new InvalidOperationException("Stack is not deep enough.");
457  else if (frame.BlockType == CodeBlockType.Callable)
458  throw new InvalidOperationException("Callable code block was encountered " + whichLevelBelow + " levels below the stack top "
459  + Environment.NewLine + " , before the specified stack level was reached.");
460  frame = (CommandStackFrame) frame.GetParentStackFrame();
461  }
462 
463  }
464  CommandStackFrame freme = cmdThread.TopFrame;
465  return ret;
466  }

718  // be terminated by the ElseIf block (while the opposite can happen):
719  frame.AddBlockExitCommandsNoLevelEffect(Command_ElseIf, Command_Else);

742  public virtual void EnterBlock(CommandThread cmdThread,
743  bool executeCommands = true, bool saveCommands = false)
744  {
745  cmdThread.WasBlockEnterCommand = true;
746  CommandStackFrame parentFrame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
747  parentFrame.ReturnedValue = null;
748  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.AddFrame(CodeBlockType.Block);
749  frame.SuppressInteractive = parentFrame.SuppressInteractive; // inherits from parent
750  // Add block enter / exit commands:
751  AddEnterExitCommands_Block(frame);
752  frame.DoExecuteCommands = executeCommands;
753  frame.DoSaveCommands = saveCommands;
754  if (!parentFrame.DoExecuteCommands)
755  {
756  frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
757  if (executeCommands && OutputLevel >= 1)
758  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "DoExecuteCommands: DoExecute commands overridden, set to false." + Environment.NewLine);
759  }
760  if (parentFrame.DoSaveCommands)
761  {
762  frame.DoSaveCommands = true;
763  if (!saveCommands && OutputLevel >= 1)
764  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "EnterBlock: DoSaveCommands commands overridden, set to false." + Environment.NewLine);
765  }
766  if (frame.LastCommandLine != null)
767  frame.BlockCommanddLine = frame.LastCommandLine;
768  }
769 
773  public virtual string ExitBlock(CommandThread cmdThread)
774  {
775  cmdThread.WasBlockExitCommand = true;
776  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
777  if (!frame.DoExecuteCommands && frame.DoSaveCommands)
778  {
779  var parentFrame = frame.GetParentStackFrame();
780  if (parentFrame == null)
781  throw new InvalidOperationException("The current frame does not have a parent (level: " + frame.StackLevel
782  + ", type: " + frame.BlockType + ".");
783  if (frame.DoSaveCommands)
784  {
785  // Remove the last stored command (because this would be the command that exits this block,
786  // and we only want commands that purely belong to the block):
787  int lastCommand = frame.CommandLines.Count - 1;
788  if (lastCommand >= 0)
789  frame.CommandLines.RemoveAt(lastCommand);
790  }
791  if (parentFrame.DoExecuteCommands)
792  {
793  // Delayed execution of commands at the end of the block:
794  frame.DoExecuteCommands = true;
795  frame.DoSaveCommands = false;
796  Run(cmdThread, frame.CommandLines);
797  frame.CommandLines.Clear();
798  frame.ConditionExpression = null;
799  frame.BlockCommanddLine = null;
800  }
801  }
802  CommandStackFrame removedFrame = cmdThread.RemoveFrame();
803  // check:
804  if (!object.ReferenceEquals(frame, removedFrame))
805  throw new InvalidOperationException("Stack frame inconsistency when exiting the block.");
806  // Save returned value of the completed block to the parent frame (which is now the top frame):
807  cmdThread.TopFrame.ReturnedValue = frame.ReturnedValue;
808  return frame.ReturnedValue;
809  }
810 
811 
818  public virtual void EnterRepeatBlock(CommandThread cmdThread,
819  int numRepetitions = 1)
820  {
821  cmdThread.WasBlockEnterCommand = true;
822  cmdThread.PushParameter(numRepetitions); // store the parameter for the corresponding closing block
823  CommandStackFrame parentFrame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
824  parentFrame.ReturnedValue = null;
825  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.AddFrame(CodeBlockType.Block);
826  frame.SuppressInteractive = parentFrame.SuppressInteractive; // inherits from parent
827  // Add block enter / exit commands:
828  AddEnterExitCommands_BeginRepeat(frame);
829  frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
830  frame.DoSaveCommands = true;
831  //if (!parentFrame.DoExecuteCommands)
832  //{
833  // frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
834  // if (executeCommands && OutputLevel >= 1)
835  // Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "DoExecuteCommands: DoExecute commands overridden, set to false." + Environment.NewLine);
836  //}
837  //if (parentFrame.DoSaveCommands)
838  //{
839  // frame.DoSaveCommands = true;
840  // if (!saveCommands && OutputLevel >= 1)
841  // Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "EnterBlock: DoSaveCommands commands overridden, set to false." + Environment.NewLine);
842  //}
843  if (frame.LastCommandLine != null)
844  frame.BlockCommanddLine = frame.LastCommandLine;
845  }
846 
850  public virtual string ExitRepeatBlock(CommandThread cmdThread)
851  {
852  string ret = null;
853  cmdThread.WasBlockExitCommand = true;
854  int numRepetitions = (int) cmdThread.GetParameterFromTop(0);
855  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
856  if (!frame.DoExecuteCommands && frame.DoSaveCommands)
857  {
858  var parentFrame = frame.GetParentStackFrame();
859  if (parentFrame == null)
860  throw new InvalidOperationException("The current frame does not have a parent (level: " + frame.StackLevel
861  + ", type: " + frame.BlockType + ".");
862  if (frame.DoSaveCommands)
863  {
864  // Remove the last stored command (because this would be the command that exits this block,
865  // and we only want commands that purely belong to the block):
866  int lastCommand = frame.CommandLines.Count - 1;
867  if (lastCommand >= 0)
868  frame.CommandLines.RemoveAt(lastCommand);
869  }
870  if (parentFrame.DoExecuteCommands)
871  {
872  // Delayed execution of commands at the end of the block:
873  frame.DoExecuteCommands = true;
874  frame.DoSaveCommands = false;
875 
876  lock (Lock) // lock the interpreter such that no other execution can affect the results (measured speed)
877  {
878  StopWatch1 t = new StopWatch1();
879  // int threadId = Thread.CurrentThread.GetHashCode();
880  int threadIdGeneral = Thread.CurrentThread.GetHashCode();
881  int interpreterThreadId = cmdThread.Id;
882  for (int i = 1; i <= numRepetitions; ++i)
883  {
884  if (OutputLevel >= 2)
885  {
886  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "Repetively running code block "
887  + i + " / " + numRepetitions + " (thread " + interpreterThreadId + ") ...");
888  }
889  t.Start();
890 
891  Run(cmdThread, frame.CommandLines);
892 
893  t.Stop();
894  if (OutputLevel >= 2)
895  {
896  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "... repetition "
897  + i + "/" + numRepetitions + " (thread " + interpreterThreadId + ") fininshed in " + t.Time + " s.");
898  }
899  }
900  double numPerSecond = (double)numRepetitions / t.TotalTime;
901  double numPerSecondCPU = (double)numRepetitions / (t.TotalCpuTime + 1.0e-20);
902  ret = numPerSecond.ToString();
903  if (OutputLevel >= 1)
904  {
905  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + numRepetitions + " repetitions of code block "
906  + " finished in " + t.TotalTime + " s (CPU: " + t.TotalCpuTime + " s)."
907  + Environment.NewLine + "Number of executions per second: " + numPerSecond + " (CPU: " + numPerSecondCPU + ").");
908 
909  }
910  }
911 
912  frame.CommandLines.Clear();
913  frame.ConditionExpression = null;
914  frame.BlockCommanddLine = null;
915  }
916  }
917  CommandStackFrame removedFrame = cmdThread.RemoveFrame(); cmdThread.PopParameter(); // parameter can be removed after removal of the frame as it belonged to the parent frame
918  // check:
919  if (!object.ReferenceEquals(frame, removedFrame))
920  throw new InvalidOperationException("Stack frame inconsistency when exiting the block.");
921  // Save returned value of the completed block to the parent frame (which is now the top frame):
922  cmdThread.TopFrame.ReturnedValue = ret;
923  return ret;
924  }
925

934  public virtual void EnterJsBlock(CommandThread cmdThread)
935  {
936  cmdThread.WasBlockEnterCommand = true;
937  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + Environment.NewLine
938  + "Entering the JavaScript code block. " + Environment.NewLine);
939 
940  CommandStackFrame parentFrame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
941  //parentFrame.ReturnedValue = null;
942  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.AddFrame(CodeBlockType.Block);
943  frame.SuppressInteractive = parentFrame.SuppressInteractive; // inherits from parent
944 
945  frame.SuppressInteractive = true;
946 
947  // Add block enter / exit commands:
948  AddEnterExitCommands_BeginCalc(frame);
949 
950  // Commands within the block will not be executed, but mast be stored in order to evaluate them
951  // after the block exits by the internal JavaScript evaluator:
952  frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
953  frame.DoSaveCommands = true;
954  // Store (for eventual inspection) the commandline that introduced the block:
955  if (frame.LastCommandLine != null)
956  frame.BlockCommanddLine = frame.LastCommandLine;
957  }

964  public virtual string ExitJsBlock(CommandThread cmdThread)
965  {
966  cmdThread.WasBlockExitCommand = true;
967  string ret = null;
968  // Concatenate the collected commandlines within the code block for execution with the JavaScript evaluator:
969  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
970  if (frame.DoSaveCommands)
971  {
972  // Remove the last stored command (because this would be the command that exits this block,
973  // and we only want commands that purely belong to the block):
974  int lastCommand = frame.CommandLines.Count - 1;
975  if (lastCommand >= 0)
976  frame.CommandLines.RemoveAt(lastCommand);
977  }
978  StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
979  foreach (string command in frame.CommandLines)
980  sb.AppendLine(command);
981  string codeBlock = sb.ToString();
982 
983  if (OutputLevel >= 3)
984  {
985  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "End of the JavaScript code block. " + Environment.NewLine
986  + "Code to be executed:" + Environment.NewLine
987  + "=====================================================================" + Environment.NewLine
988  + codeBlock // + Environment.NewLine
989  + "---------------------------------------------------------------------" + Environment.NewLine
990  + Environment.NewLine);
991  }
992  // Exit the current stack frame such that code is exected in the containing frame:
993  CommandStackFrame removedFrame = cmdThread.RemoveFrame();
994  // Check stack frames consistency:
995  if (!object.ReferenceEquals(frame, removedFrame))
996  throw new InvalidOperationException("Stack frame inconsistency when exiting the block.");
997  // Execute the code in the JavaScript evaluator:
998  ret = EvaluateJs(codeBlock);
999 
1000 
1001  // Save returned value of the completed block to the parent frame (which is now the top frame):
1002  // cmdThread.TopFrame.ReturnedValue = ret;
1003  return ret;
1004  }

1010  {

1013  parentFrame.ReturnedValue = null;
1014  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.AddFrame(CodeBlockType.If);
1015  frame.SuppressInteractive = parentFrame.SuppressInteractive; // inherits from parent
1016  // Add block enter / exit commands:
1017  AddEnterExitCommands_If(frame);
1018 
1019  // frame.DoExecuteCommands = executeCommands;
1020  // frame.DoSaveCommands = saveCommands;
1021  if (parentFrame.DoSaveCommands)
1022  {
1023  frame.DoSaveCommands = true;
1024  }
1025  if (!parentFrame.DoExecuteCommands)
1026  {
1027  frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
1028  } else
1029  {
1030  if (condition)
1031  {
1032  frame.DoExecuteCommands = true;
1033  frame.WasBranchAlreadyExecuted = true;
1034  }
1035  else
1036  frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
1037  }

1045  public virtual void EnterElseIf(CommandThread cmdThread, bool condition)
1046  {

1052  parentFrame.ReturnedValue = previousFrame.ReturnedValue;
1053  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.AddFrame(CodeBlockType.If);
1054  frame.SuppressInteractive = parentFrame.SuppressInteractive; // inherits from parent
1055  frame.ReturnedValue = previousFrame.ReturnedValue;
1056  // Add block enter / exit commands:
1057  AddEnterExitCommands_ElseIf(frame);
1058  frame.WasBranchAlreadyExecuted = previousFrame.WasBranchAlreadyExecuted; // transfer this information to the current block
1059  if (parentFrame.DoSaveCommands)
1060  {
1061  frame.DoSaveCommands = true;
1062  }
1063  if (!parentFrame.DoExecuteCommands)
1064  {
1065  frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
1066  } else
1067  {
1068  frame.DoExecuteCommands = false;
1069  if (!frame.WasBranchAlreadyExecuted)
1070  {
1071  // Any of the related if branches has not been executed yet, check condition and execute if appropriate:
1072  if (condition)
1073  {
1074  frame.DoExecuteCommands = true;
1075  frame.WasBranchAlreadyExecuted = true;
1076  }
1077  }
1078  }
1079  if (frame.LastCommandLine != null)
1080  frame.BlockCommanddLine = frame.LastCommandLine;
1081  }

1161  public virtual string ExitWhile(CommandThread cmdThread)
1162  {
1163  cmdThread.WasBlockExitCommand = true;
1164  string ret = null;
1165  // Concatenate the collected commandlines within the code block for execution with the JavaScript evaluator:
1166  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
1167  bool storeDoExecute = frame.DoExecuteCommands;
1168  bool storeDoSave = frame.DoSaveCommands;
1169  // bool storeOppressInteractive = frame.OppressInteractive;
1170  if (storeDoSave)
1171  {
1172  // Remove the last stored command (because this would be the command that exits this block,
1173  // and we only want commands that purely belong to the block):
1174  int lastCommand = frame.CommandLines.Count - 1;
1175  if (lastCommand >= 0)
1176  frame.CommandLines.RemoveAt(lastCommand);
1177  }
1178  // Execute stored commands in a loop where condition is checked in each iteration:
1179  frame.DoExecuteCommands = true;
1180  frame.DoSaveCommands = false;
1181  bool condition = false;
1182  string conditionString = frame.ConditionExpression;
1183  string evaluatedContidion = EvaluateJs(conditionString);
1184  bool parsed = Util.TryParseBoolean(evaluatedContidion, ref condition);
1185  // Store commands because stack frames may change within the loop:
1186  string[] commands = frame.CommandLines.ToArray();
1187  int numCommands = commands.Length;
1188  while (condition)
1189  {
1190  for (int i = 0; i < numCommands; ++i)
1191  {
1192  ret = Run(cmdThread, commands[i]);
1193  }
1194  // Re-evaluate condition in order to enter a new loop iteration if this is appropriate:
1195  evaluatedContidion = EvaluateJs(conditionString);
1196  parsed = Util.TryParseBoolean(evaluatedContidion, ref condition);
1197  }
1198 
1199  //Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "End of the JavaScript code block. " + Environment.NewLine
1200  // + "Code to be executed:" + Environment.NewLine
1201  // + "=====================================================================" + Environment.NewLine
1202  // + codeBlock // + Environment.NewLine
1203  // + "---------------------------------------------------------------------" + Environment.NewLine
1204  // + Environment.NewLine);
1205 
1206  // Restore saved flags:
1207  frame.DoExecuteCommands = storeDoExecute;
1208  frame.DoSaveCommands = storeDoSave;
1209  frame.SuppressInteractive = false;
1210 
1211  // Exit the current stack frame such that code is exected in the containing frame:
1212  CommandStackFrame removedFrame = cmdThread.RemoveFrame();
1213  // Check stack frames consistency:
1214  if (!object.ReferenceEquals(frame, removedFrame))
1215  throw new InvalidOperationException("Stack frame inconsistency when exiting the block.");
1216  // Save returned value of the completed block to the parent frame (which is now the top frame):
1217  cmdThread.TopFrame.ReturnedValue = ret;
1218  return ret;
1219  }

1242  public virtual string RunFile(CommandThread cmdThread, string filePath)
1243  {
1244  if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(filePath))
1245  throw new ArgumentException("Path of the file to be run by a command-line interpreter is not specified.");
1246  else if (!File.Exists(filePath))
1247  throw new ArgumentException("File to be run by a command-line interpreter does not exist. File path: "
1248  + Environment.NewLine + " " + filePath);
1249  using (StreamReader sr = new StreamReader(filePath))
1250  {
1251  string line;
1252  string ret = null;
1253  int lineNum = 0;
1254  while ((line = sr.ReadLine()) != null)
1255  {
1256  if (Exit)
1257  return ret;
1258  ++lineNum;
1259  try
1260  {
1261  ret = Run(cmdThread, line);
1262  //if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(line))
1263  //{
1264  // string[] commandLineSplit = GetArguments(line);
1265  // ret = Run(cmdThread, commandLineSplit);
1266  //}
1267  }
1268  catch (Exception ex)
1269  {
1270  Exception exRethrown = new InvalidOperationException("Error in line " + lineNum + ", interpreted file: "
1271  + Environment.NewLine + " " + filePath + Environment.NewLine
1272  + " Details: " + ex.Message, ex /* innerException */);
1273  throw (exRethrown);
1274  }
1275  }
1276  return ret;
1277  }
1278  }

1298  public virtual string RunInteractive(CommandThread cmdThread)
1299  {
1300  Console.WriteLine();
1301  Console.WriteLine("Interactive interpreter started.");
1302  Console.WriteLine("Insert commands line by line. Press Enter to exit.");
1303  Console.WriteLine();
1304  bool doExit = false;
1305  string line;
1306  string ret = null;
1307  while (!doExit)
1308  {
1309  if (Exit)
1310  {
1311  Console.WriteLine("Exiting interpreter...");
1312  Console.WriteLine("Bye.");
1313  return ret;
1314  }
1315  Console.Write("Cmd>");
1316  line = Console.ReadLine();
1317  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame; // must stand here to capture the current stack frame every time
1318  if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(line) && !frame.SuppressInteractive && !cmdThread.SuppressInteractive)
1319  {
1320  try
1321  {
1322  Console.WriteLine();
1323  Console.Write("Exit the interactive interpreter (0/1)? ");
1324  UtilConsole.Read(ref doExit);
1325  if (doExit)
1326  {
1327  Console.WriteLine("Exiting interactive mode...");
1328  if (!AsyncIsAllCompleted())
1329  {
1330  bool waitAsync = true;
1331  Console.WriteLine();
1332  Console.Write("Wait for asynchronous jobs to complete (0/1)? ");
1333  UtilConsole.Read(ref waitAsync);
1334  if (waitAsync)
1335  {
1336  AsyncWaitAll();
1337  }
1338  }
1339  Console.WriteLine("Bye." + Environment.NewLine);
1340  }
1341  }
1342  catch (Exception ex)
1343  {
1344  Console.WriteLine("ERROR: " + ex.Message);
1345  //if (ThrowExceptions)
1346  // throw;
1347  }
1348  }
1349  else
1350  {
1351  try
1352  {
1353  ret = Run(cmdThread, line);
1354  //string[] commandLineSplit = GetArguments(line);
1355  //ret = this.Run(cmdThread, commandLineSplit);
1356  if (cmdThread.WasCommandExecuted && !cmdThread.WasBlockEnterCommand)
1357  {
1358  string retOutput = ret;
1359  if (retOutput == null)
1360  retOutput = "null";
1361  else if (retOutput == "")
1362  retOutput = "\"\"";
1363  if (!frame.SuppressInteractive && !cmdThread.SuppressInteractive)
1364  {
1365  Console.WriteLine(" = " + retOutput);
1366  }
1367  }
1368  }
1369  catch (Exception ex)
1370  {
1371  Console.WriteLine();
1372  Console.WriteLine("ERROR: " + ex.Message);
1373  Console.WriteLine();
1374  if (ThrowExceptions)
1375  throw;
1376  }
1377  }
1378  }
1379  return ret;
1380  }

1493  public ExpressionEvaluatorJs EvaluatorJs
1494  {
1495  get
1496  {
1497  ExpressionEvaluatorJs ret;
1498  lock (Lock)
1499  {
1500  if (UseJint)
1501  {
1502  if (_evaluatorJint == null)
1503  {
1504  lock (Lock)
1505  {
1506  if (_evaluatorJint == null)
1507  _evaluatorJint = new ExpressionEvaluatorJint();
1508  }
1509  }
1510  ret = _evaluatorJint;
1511  }
1512  else
1513  {
1514  if (_evalutorJs == null)
1515  {
1516  lock (Lock)
1517  {
1518  if (_evalutorJs == null)
1519  _evalutorJs = new ExpressionEvaluatorJs();
1520  }
1521  }
1522  ret = _evalutorJs;
1523  }
1524  }
1525  return ret;
1526  }
1527  protected set
1528  {
1529  lock (Lock)
1530  {
1531  if (UseJint)
1532  _evaluatorJint = value as ExpressionEvaluatorJint;
1533  else
1534  _evalutorJs = value as ExpressionEvaluatorJs;
1535  }
1536  }
1537  }

1598  protected virtual bool GetCommandDelegate(string commandName, ref ApplicationCommandDelegateMt appDelegate)
1599  {
1600  lock (Lock)
1601  {
1602  bool ret;
1603  appDelegate = null;
1604  if (!_caseSensitive)
1605  commandName = commandName.ToLower();
1606  ret = _commandsMt.ContainsKey(commandName);
1607  if (ret)
1608  appDelegate = _commandsMt[commandName];
1609  return ret;
1610  }

1691  public virtual string RunRepeat(CommandThread cmdThread, int outputLevel, string[] args)
1692  {
1693  lock (Lock) // lock interpreter so that other executions can not change the results
1694  {
1695  if (args == null)
1696  throw new ArgumentNullException("Commandline is not specified (null reference);");
1697  else if (args.Length < 2)
1698  throw new ArgumentNullException("Number of repetitions and command name are not specified.");
1699  else
1700  {
1701  string[] cmdArgs = new string[args.Length - 2];
1702  int numRepetitions = int.Parse(args[0]);
1703  string cmdName = args[1];
1704  for (int i = 2; i < args.Length; ++i)
1705  {
1706  cmdArgs[i - 2] = args[i];
1707  }
1708  string ret = "";
1709  StopWatch1 t = new StopWatch1();
1710  int threadId = Thread.CurrentThread.GetHashCode();
1711  for (int i = 1; i <= numRepetitions; ++i)
1712  {
1713  if (outputLevel >= 2)
1714  {
1715  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "Repeatively running command "
1716  + i + " / " + numRepetitions + " (thread " + threadId + ") ...");
1717  }
1718  t.Start();
1719  // ret = ret + " " +
1720  Run(cmdThread, cmdName, cmdArgs);
1721  t.Stop();
1722  if (outputLevel >= 2)
1723  {
1724  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "... repetition "
1725  + i + "/" + numRepetitions + " (thread " + threadId + ") fininshed in " + t.Time + " s.");
1726  }
1727  }
1728  double numPerSecond = (double)numRepetitions / t.TotalTime;
1729  double numPerSecondCPU = (double) numRepetitions / (t.TotalCpuTime + 1.0e-20);
1730  ret = numPerSecond.ToString();
1731  if (outputLevel >= 1)
1732  {
1733  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + numRepetitions + " repetitions of command " + cmdName
1734  + " finished in " + t.TotalTime + " s (CPU: " + t.TotalCpuTime + " s)."
1735  + Environment.NewLine + "Number of executions per second: " + numPerSecond + " (CPU: " + numPerSecondCPU + ").");
1736 
1737  }
1738  return ret;
1739  }
1740  }
1741  }
1742 
1750  public virtual string RunTryCatch(CommandThread cmdThread, int outputLevel, string[] args)
1751  {
1752  lock (Lock)
1753  {
1754  if (args == null)
1755  throw new ArgumentNullException("Commandline is not specified (null reference);");
1756  else if (args.Length < 1)
1757  throw new ArgumentNullException("Command is not not specified.");
1758  else
1759  {
1760  string[] cmdArgs = new string[args.Length - 1];
1761  string cmdName = args[0];
1762  for (int i = 1; i < args.Length; ++i)
1763  {
1764  cmdArgs[i - 1] = args[i];
1765  }
1766  string ret = "";
1767  try
1768  {
1769  if (outputLevel >= 2)
1770  {
1771  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "Runninng command " + cmdName + " in a try-catch block ...");
1772  }
1773  ret = Run(cmdThread, cmdName, cmdArgs);
1774  if (outputLevel >= 2)
1775  {
1776  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "... command run successfully." + Environment.NewLine);
1777  }
1778  }
1779  catch (Exception ex)
1780  {
1781  ret = "ERROR: " + ex.Message;
1782  if (outputLevel >= 1)
1783  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "ERROR: " + ex.Message + Environment.NewLine);
1784  }
1785  return ret;
1786  }
1787  }

1823  public string RunWithoutModifications(CommandThread cmdThread, string commandName, params string[] commandArguments)
1824  {
1825  string ret = null;
1826  cmdThread.WasCommandExecuted = false;
1827  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
1828  bool doExecuteFurther = true;
1829  if (!frame.DoExecuteCommands)
1830  {
1831  // Execution is switched off. Control will still be passed to further evaluation function in the case
1832  // that commandline can represent one of the possible block enter or exit commands for the current
1833  // kind of the code block. Thi is in order to execute the appropriate block exit command, even
1834  // if the command execution is crrently switched off.
1835  doExecuteFurther = false;
1836  // Check if the command could eventually represent a block enter or block exit command (without side effects):
1837  if (frame.CheckForBlockEnterOrExitCommand(commandName, justCheck: true, isOnlyCommandName: true))
1838  {
1839  // Yes, now check for real (with possible side effects on frame), but only if the command is actually
1840  // installed on the interpreter (this also safeguards for mistakes that may occur due to case sensitivity
1841  // of the interpreter):
1842  if (this.ContainsCommand(commandName))
1843  {
1844  // Test condition before CheckForBlockEnterOrExitCommand, because that one will already
1845  // reduce the level! We still want to have the same level as before.
1846  bool isBlockExitQuiet = frame.IsBlockExitQuietCommand(commandName, isOnlyCommandName: true);
1847  if (frame.CheckForBlockEnterOrExitCommand(commandName, justCheck: false, isOnlyCommandName: true))
1848  if (isBlockExitQuiet)
1849  {
1850  // Command will be executed in spite of the fact that execution is switched off; This is because
1851  // the command represents the exit block command for the bolck that actually switched off execution.
1852  doExecuteFurther = true;
1853  }
1854  }
1855  }
1856  }
1857  if (doExecuteFurther)
1858  {
1859  ApplicationCommandDelegateMt appDelegate = null;
1860  lock (Lock)
1861  {
1862  //if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(commandName))
1863  // throw new ArgumentException("Command name is not specified.");
1864  // Perform substitution of variables with their values in command name and argumnets:
1865  commandName = SubstituteVariableOrExpressionReference(MainThread, commandName);
1866  if (commandArguments != null)
1867  {
1868  for (int i = 0; i < commandArguments.Length; ++i)
1869  {
1870  commandArguments[i] = SubstituteVariableOrExpressionReference(cmdThread, commandArguments[i]);
1871  }
1872  }
1873 
1874 
1875  //{
1876  // bool substituteArgs = false;
1877  // if (commandArguments != null)
1878  // {
1879  // for (int i = 0; i < commandArguments.Length; ++i)
1880  // {
1881  // if (IsVariableReference(MainThread, commandArguments[i]))
1882  // {
1883  // substituteArgs = true;
1884  // break;
1885  // }
1886  // }
1887  // if (substituteArgs)
1888  // {
1889  // string[] argsSubstituted = new string[commandArguments.Length];
1890  // for (int i = 0; i < commandArguments.Length; ++i)
1891  // argsSubstituted[i] = SubstituteVariableReference(MainThread, commandArguments[i]);
1892  // commandArguments = argsSubstituted;
1893  // }
1894  // }
1895  //}
1896 
1897  if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(commandName))
1898  {
1899  // Empty string will just be ignored.
1900  }
1901  else
1902  {
1903  bool containsCommand = GetCommandDelegate(commandName, ref appDelegate);
1904  if (!containsCommand)
1905  throw new ArgumentException("Interpreter does not contain the following command: \"" + commandName + "\".");
1906  if (appDelegate == null)
1907  {
1908  throw new InvalidOperationException("Command not properly installed on the interpreter: \"" + commandName + "\".");
1909  }
1910  else
1911  {
1912  ret = appDelegate(cmdThread, commandName, commandArguments);
1913  cmdThread.WasCommandExecuted = true;
1914  frame.ReturnedValue = ret;
1915  }
1916  }
1917  } // lock
1918  }
1919  return ret;
1920  }

1944  public string Run(CommandThread cmdThread, string[] args)
1945  {
1946  if (args == null)
1947  throw new ArgumentNullException("Commandline is not specified (null reference);");
1948  else if (args.Length < 1)
1949  throw new ArgumentNullException("Command name is not specified.");
1950  else
1951  {
1952  string[] cmdArgs = new string[args.Length - 1];
1953  string cmdName = args[0];
1954  for (int i = 1; i < args.Length; ++i)
1955  {

1971  public string Run(CommandThread cmdThread, string commandLine)
1972  {
1973  string ret = null;
1974  cmdThread.WasCommandExecuted = false;
1975  CommandStackFrame frame = cmdThread.TopFrame;
1976  frame.LastCommandLine = commandLine;
1977  if (frame.DoSaveCommands)
1978  frame.CommandLines.Add(commandLine);
1979  bool doExecuteFurther = true;
1980  if (!frame.DoExecuteCommands)
1981  {
1982  // Execution is switched off. Control will still be passed to further evaluation function in the case
1983  // that commandline can represent one of the possible block enter or exit commands for the current
1984  // kind of the code block. Thi is in order to execute the appropriate block exit command, even
1985  // if the command execution is crrently switched off.
1986  doExecuteFurther = false;
1987  if (frame.CheckForBlockEnterOrExitCommand(commandLine, justCheck: true, isOnlyCommandName: false))
1988  doExecuteFurther = true;
1989  }
1990  if (doExecuteFurther) // don't bother if execution is switched off!
1991  {
1992  if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(commandLine))
1993  {
1994  string[] commandLineSplit;
1995  try
1996  {
1997  commandLineSplit = GetArguments(commandLine);
1998  }
1999  catch { commandLineSplit = EmptyCommandLine; }
2000  ret = Run(cmdThread, commandLineSplit);
2001  }
2002  }
2003  return ret;
2004  }

2081  public void PrintParallelCommands(bool printAll)
2082  {
2083  StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
2084  sb.AppendLine();
2085  sb.AppendLine("System for parallel execution of commands:");
2086  ParallelJobDispatcherGen<CommandLineJobContainer, CommandLineJobContainer> dispatcher = _parallelDispatcher;
2087  if (dispatcher == null)
2088  sb.AppendLine("Parallel dispatcher is not initialized.");
2089  else
2090  {
2091  sb.AppendLine(" Number of parallel servers: " + dispatcher.NumJobServers);
2092  sb.AppendLine(" Number of idle servers: " + dispatcher.NumIdleJobServers);
2093  sb.AppendLine(" Commands: ");
2094  sb.AppendLine(" Total scheduled for execution: " + dispatcher.NumSentJobs);
2095  sb.AppendLine(" Finished: " + dispatcher.NumFinishedJobs);
2096  sb.AppendLine(" Executing: " + dispatcher.NumExecutingJobs);
2097  sb.AppendLine(" Enqueued: " + dispatcher.NumEnqueuedJobs);
2098  }
2099  sb.AppendLine();
2100  if (printAll)
2101  sb.AppendLine("List of all parallel commands:");
2102  else
2103  sb.AppendLine("List of unfinished parallel commands:");
2104  lock (Lock)
2105  {
2106  if (_parallelCommands == null)
2107  sb.AppendLine(" The list of parallel commands is empty.");
2108  else if (_parallelCommands.Count < 0)
2109  sb.AppendLine(" The list of parallel commands is empty.");
2110  else
2111  {
2112  int numUnfinished = 0, numAll = 0, numNull = 0;
2113  foreach (CommandLineJobContainer container in _parallelCommands)
2114  {
2115  if (container == null)
2116  {
2117  ++numNull;
2118  if (printAll)
2119  sb.AppendLine("null container.");
2120  }
2121  else
2122  {
2123  ++numAll;
2124  if (container.State < ParallelJobState.ResultsReady)
2125  ++numUnfinished;
2126  if (container.State < ParallelJobState.ResultsReady || printAll)
2127  {
2128  sb.AppendLine();
2129  sb.Append(container.ToString());
2130  }
2131  }
2132  }
2133  if (printAll && numAll < 1)
2134  sb.AppendLine(" No commands in the list.");
2135  else if (!printAll && numUnfinished < 1)
2136  sb.AppendLine(" No unfinished commands.");
2137  sb.AppendLine();
2138  sb.AppendLine("Total number of parallel commands: " + numAll);
2139  sb.AppendLine(" Number of unfinished: " + numUnfinished);
2140  if (numNull > 0)
2141  sb.AppendLine(" Number of null: " + numNull);
2142  }
2143  }
2144  sb.AppendLine();
2145  Console.WriteLine(sb.ToString());
2146  }

2284  public int[] RunParallelRepeat(int numRepeat, string command, string[] commandArguments)
2285  {
2286  if (numRepeat < 1)
2287  throw new ArgumentException("Number of repetitions can not be less than 1.");
2288  else if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(command))
2289  throw new ArgumentException("Command to be executed in parallel is not specified (null or empty string).");
2290  int[] ret = new int[numRepeat];
2291 
2292  Console.WriteLine("Executing command in " + numRepeat + " parallel threads...");
2293 
2294  ParallelJobDispatcherGen<CommandLineJobContainer, CommandLineJobContainer> dispatcher;
2295  lock (Lock)
2296  {
2297  dispatcher = ParallelDispatcher;
2298  if (dispatcher.NumIdleJobServers < numRepeat && (_maxNumParallelServers < 1
2299  || dispatcher.NumJobServers < _maxNumParallelServers))
2300  {
2301  // If the number of currently idle servers is smaller than the number of parallel jobs scheduled,
2302  // then create more servers if this is allowed, such that all jobs will start immediatrly.
2303  lock (dispatcher.Lock)
2304  {
2305  while (dispatcher.NumIdleJobServers < numRepeat && (_maxNumParallelServers < 1
2306  || dispatcher.NumJobServers < _maxNumParallelServers))
2307  {
2308  ParallelJobServerGen<CommandLineJobContainer, CommandLineJobContainer> server =
2309  new ParallelJobServerGen<CommandLineJobContainer, CommandLineJobContainer>();
2310  dispatcher.AddServer(server);
2311  }
2312  }
2313  }
2314 
2315 
2316  Console.WriteLine("Dispatcher acquired and servers prepared.");
2317 
2318  }
2319  for (int iJob = 0; iJob < numRepeat; ++iJob)
2320  {
2321  CommandLineJobContainer container = new CommandLineJobContainer(this, command, commandArguments);
2322  // container.Input = container;
2323  container.ClientJobId = container.Id;
2324  ret[iJob] = container.Id;
2325  // Set callback for job aborted event by anonymous function:
2326  container.OnAbortedGeneric = delegate(ParallelJobContainerGen<CommandLineJobContainer, CommandLineJobContainer>
2327  jobContaier)
2328  {
2329  Console.WriteLine(Environment.NewLine + "ERROR: Parallel interpreter command aborted. "
2330  + Environment.NewLine + " job ID: " + container.Id
2331  + Environment.NewLine + " commad: " + container.CommandName
2332  + Environment.NewLine);
2333  throw new InvalidOperationException("Parallel interpreter command aborted. "
2334  + Environment.NewLine + " job ID: " + container.Id
2335  + Environment.NewLine + " commad: " + container.CommandName);
2336  };
2337  // Set callback for job started event:
2338  container.OnStartedGeneric = delegate(ParallelJobContainerGen<CommandLineJobContainer, CommandLineJobContainer> jobContaier)
2339  {
2340  if (OutputLevel >= 1)
2341  {
2342  Console.WriteLine("Parallel command started, ID = " + container.Id.ToString() + ".");
2343  }
2344  };
2345  // Set callback for job finished event:
2346  container.OnFinishedGeneric = delegate(ParallelJobContainerGen<CommandLineJobContainer, CommandLineJobContainer> jobContaier)
2347  {
2348  if (OutputLevel >= 1)
2349  {
2350  string str = "Parallel command finished, ID = " + container.Id.ToString() + ".";
2351  if (OutputLevel >= 2)
2352  {
2353  str += Environment.NewLine + " " + container.CommandName + " ";
2354  if (container.CommandArguments != null)
2355  {
2356  for (int i = 0; i < container.CommandArguments.Length; ++i)
2357  str += container.CommandArguments[i] + " ";
2358  }
2359  str += Environment.NewLine + " = " + container.Result;
2360  }
2361  Console.WriteLine(str);
2362  }
2363  };
2364 
2365  Console.WriteLine("Sending command No. " + container.Id + "...");
2366 
2367  AddParallelCommand(container);
2368 
2369  dispatcher.SendJob(container);
2370 
2371  Console.WriteLine(" ... sending command No. " + container.Id + " done.");
2372 
2373  }
2374  return ret;
2375  }
2376

2452  public virtual string RunAsync(CommandThread cmdThread,
2453  string commandName, params string[] commandArguments)
2454  {
2455  // TODO: use normal Run() instead of directly the command delegate!
2456  // TODO: Copy stack frames to the execution environment
2457 
2458 
2459  int asyncId = -1;
2460  ApplicationCommandDelegateMt appDelegate = null;
2461  lock (Lock)
2462  {
2463  //if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(commandName))
2464  // throw new ArgumentException("Command name is not specified.");
2465  // Perform substitution of variables and calc. expressions with their values in command name and argumnets:
2466  commandName = SubstituteVariableOrExpressionReference(cmdThread, commandName);
2467  for (int i = 0; i < commandArguments.Length; ++i)
2468  {
2469  commandArguments[i] = SubstituteVariableOrExpressionReference(cmdThread, commandArguments[i]);
2470  }
2471

2490  if (!_caseSensitive)
2491  commandName = commandName.ToLower();

2493  throw new ArgumentException("Interpreter does not contain the following command: " + commandName + ".");
2494  appDelegate = _commandsMt[commandName];

2503  AsyncCommandResults.Add(result);

2505  return asyncId.ToString();

2523  public bool AsyncIsCompleted(int id)
2524  {
2525  if (id < 0)
2526  throw new ArgumentException("Asynchronous command execution ID can not be less than 0.");
2527  lock (Lock)
2528  {
2529  if (AsyncCommandResults.Count <= id)
2530  throw new IndexOutOfRangeException("Asynchronous command execution ID " + id + " is greater than the largest ID.");
2531  return AsyncCommandResults[id].IsCompleted;
2532  }
2533  }
2534 
2536  public bool AsyncIsAllCompleted()
2537  {
2538  lock (Lock)
2539  {
2540  bool ret = true;
2541  int numAsync = 0;
2542  numAsync = AsyncCommandResults.Count;
2543  for (int i = 0; i < numAsync; ++i)
2544  ret = ret && AsyncIsCompleted(i);
2545  return ret;
2546  }
2547  }

2553  public void AsyncWaitAll()
2554  {
2555  int numAsync = 0;
2556  lock (Lock)
2557  {
2558  numAsync = AsyncCommandResults.Count;
2559  }
2560  for (int i = 0; i < numAsync; ++i)
2561  AsyncWait(i);

2564 
2568  public string AsyncWait(int callId)
2569  {
2570 #if !NETFRAMEWORK
2571  throw new IG.Lib.FrameworkDependencyException("AsyncWait(...): AsyncResult is not defined.");
2572 #else
2573  int Id = -1;
2574  string commandResult = null;
2575  lock (Lock) // lock in order to prevent modification of the AsyncEndInvokeInCallback flag in other threads
2576  {
2577  bool flagvalue = AsyncEndInvokeInCallback;
2578  try
2579  {
2580  if (callId < 0 || callId >= AsyncCommandResults.Count)
2581  throw new IndexOutOfRangeException("Asyncronous call ID " + callId + " is out of range.");
2582  AsyncEndInvokeInCallback = false; // because EndInvoke is called here
2583  if (OutputLevel > 0)
2584  {
2585  Console.WriteLine();
2586  Console.WriteLine("Waiting for async. command call to complete, command ID = " + callId + "...");
2587  }
2588  AsyncResult result = (AsyncResult)AsyncCommandResults[callId];
2589  Id = (int)result.AsyncState;
2590  if (result.IsCompleted)
2591  {
2592  if (OutputLevel > 0)
2593  {
2594  Console.WriteLine();
2595  Console.WriteLine("Asynchronous command already completed before, command ID: " + callId);
2596  Console.WriteLine();
2597  }
2598  }
2599  else
2600  {
2601  ApplicationCommandDelegateMt caller = (ApplicationCommandDelegateMt)result.AsyncDelegate; // retrieve the delegate
2602  // Call EndInvoke to retrieve the results.
2603  commandResult = caller.EndInvoke(result);
2604  if (OutputLevel > 0)
2605  {
2606  Console.WriteLine();
2607  Console.WriteLine("Asynchronous command completed, command ID: " + callId);
2608  Console.WriteLine(" command result: " + commandResult);
2609  Console.WriteLine();
2610  }
2611  }
2612  }
2613  catch (Exception ex)
2614  {
2615  if (OutputLevel > 0)
2616  {
2617  Console.WriteLine();
2618  Console.WriteLine("Exception thrown in callback of asynchronous command call. Call ID: " + callId
2619  + Environment.NewLine + " Error message: " + ex.Message);
2620  Console.WriteLine();
2621  }
2622  }
2623  finally
2624  {
2625  AsyncEndInvokeInCallback = flagvalue;
2626  }
2627  }
2628  return commandResult;
2629 #endif // if NETFRAMEWORK
2630  }
2631 
2632 
2633 
2636  protected void AsyncRunCallback(IAsyncResult ar)
2637  {
2638 #if !NETFRAMEWORK
2639  throw new IG.Lib.FrameworkDependencyException("AsyncRunCallback(...): AsyncResult is not defined.");
2640 #else
2641  lock (Lock)
2642  {
2643  int Id = -1;
2644  try
2645  {
2646  AsyncResult result = (AsyncResult)ar;
2647  Id = (int)ar.AsyncState;
2648  ApplicationCommandDelegateMt caller = (ApplicationCommandDelegateMt)result.AsyncDelegate; // retrieve the delegate
2649  string returnValue = null;
2650  // Call EndInvoke to retrieve the results.
2651  if (AsyncEndInvokeInCallback)
2652  {
2653  returnValue = caller.EndInvoke(ar);
2654  }
2655  if (OutputLevel > 0)
2656  {
2657  Console.WriteLine();
2658  Console.WriteLine("Asynchronous command completed, command ID: " + Id);
2659  if (AsyncEndInvokeInCallback)
2660  Console.WriteLine(" command result: " + returnValue);
2661  Console.WriteLine();
2662  }
2663  }
2664  catch (Exception ex)
2665  {
2666  if (OutputLevel > 0)
2667  {
2668  Console.WriteLine();
2669  Console.WriteLine("Exception thrown in callback of asynchronous command call. Call ID: " + Id
2670  + Environment.NewLine + " Error message: " + ex.Message);
2671  Console.WriteLine();
2672  }
2673  }
2674  finally
2675  {
2676  }
2677  }
2678 #endif
2679  }

4128  protected virtual string CmdWrite(CommandThread cmdThread,
4129  string cmdName, string[] args)
4130  {
4131  string ret = null;
4132  if (args != null)
4133  if (args.Length > 0)
4134  if (args[0] == "?")
4135  {
4136  string executableName = UtilSystem.GetCurrentProcessExecutableName();
4137  Console.WriteLine();
4138  Console.WriteLine(executableName + " " + cmdName + " arg1 arg2 ... : prints the arguments arg1, etc.");
4139  Console.WriteLine();
4140  return null;
4141  }
4142  StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
4143  if (args == null)
4144  sb.Append("");
4145  else if (args.Length < 1)
4146  sb.Append("");

5952  + " runs a command based on internal (compiled) scrip class.");
5953  Console.WriteLine(" classFullName: full name of the script class (including namespace)"
5954  + Environment.NewLine + " that is executed.");

6043  protected virtual string CmdLoadScript(CommandThread cmdThread,
6044  string cmdName, string[] args)
6045  {
6046  if (args != null)
6047  if (args.Length > 0)
6048  if (args[0] == "?")
6049  {
6050  string executableName = UtilSystem.GetCurrentProcessExecutableName();
6051  Console.WriteLine();
6052  Console.WriteLine(executableName + " " + cmdName + " cmdName scriptFile initArg1 initArg2 ... :" + Environment.NewLine
6053  + " instals a new command based on dynamically compiled script loaded form a file.");
6054  Console.WriteLine(" cmdName : name of the newly installed command");
6055  Console.WriteLine(" scriptFile: path to the file that contains dynamically loadable script "
6056  + Environment.NewLine + " defining execution of new command.");
6057  Console.WriteLine("The rest of the arguments (optional) will be passed to initialization method of the class "
6058  + Environment.NewLine + " loaded from the script file.");
6059  Console.WriteLine();
6060  return null;
6061  }
6062  if (args == null)
6063  throw new ArgumentException(cmdName + ": No arguments provided (null array). " + Environment.NewLine +
6064  " There should be at least command name and script file path.");
6065  if (args.Length == 0)
6066  throw new ArgumentException(cmdName + ": No arguments provided (empty array). " + Environment.NewLine +
6067  " There should be at least command name and script file path.");
6068  if (args.Length == 1)
6069  throw new ArgumentException(cmdName + ": Script file path is not specified.");
6070  string newCommandName = args[0];
6071  string scriptFilePath = args[1];
6072  if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(newCommandName))
6073  throw new ArgumentException(cmdName + ": command name is not specified (null or empty string).");
6074  if (string.IsNullOrEmpty(scriptFilePath))
6075  throw new ArgumentException(cmdName + ": dynamic scritp file is not specified (null or empty string).");
6076  string[] initArgs = new string[args.Length - 2];
6077  for (int i = 0; i < initArgs.Length; ++i)
6078  initArgs[i] = args[i + 2];
6079  // Add new dynamically loaded command on the LoadableScriptInterpreter, loaded form script file,
6080  // and add the command to the current interpreter.
6081  LoadScript(newCommandName, scriptFilePath, initArgs);
6082  // Add new command with the same name on the current interpreter, such that command will execute
6083  // teh dynamically loaded command on LoadableScriptInterpreter when executed:
6084  this.AddCommandMt(newCommandName, CmdRunLoadedScript);
6085  return null;
6086  } // CmdLoadScript()

6540  protected virtual string CmdTestSpeed(CommandThread cmdThread,
6541  string cmdName, string[] args)
6542  {
6543  if (args != null)
6544  if (args.Length > 0)
6545  if (args[0] == "?")
6546  {
6547  string executableName = UtilSystem.GetCurrentProcessExecutableName();
6548  Console.WriteLine();
6549  Console.WriteLine(executableName + " " + cmdName + " numRepeats : tests current speed of numerical computation.");
6550  Console.WriteLine(" numRepeats: number of times the test is repeated (to calculate average time).");
6551  Console.WriteLine();
6552  return null;
6553  }
6554  int numEquations = TestSpeedNumEq;
6555  int numRepeats = 1;
6556  if (args != null)
6557  if (args.Length > 0)
6558  numRepeats = int.Parse(args[0]);
6559  Console.WriteLine();
6560  Console.WriteLine("Test of speed of numerical computation in current environment... ");
6561  double averageTime = 0.0;
6562  double totalTime = 0.0;
6563  int threadId = Thread.CurrentThread.GetHashCode();
6564  for (int i = 1; i <= numRepeats; ++i)
6565  {
6566  if (numRepeats > 1)
6567  {
6568  Console.WriteLine();
6569  Console.WriteLine("Repetition No. " + i + " / " + numRepeats + " (thread " + threadId + ") ...");
6570  }
6571  double currentTime = TestComputationalTimesLU(numEquations, 0);
6572  totalTime += currentTime;
6573  averageTime = totalTime / (double)i;
6574  if (numRepeats > 1)
6575  {
6576  Console.WriteLine("... done (" + i + "/" + numRepeats + ", thread " + threadId + ")"
6577  + Environment.NewLine + " in " + currentTime + " s.");
6578  Console.WriteLine(" Average time: " + averageTime + " s, factor: " + (TestSpeedReferenceTime / averageTime));
6579  }
6580  }
6581  Console.WriteLine();
6582  Console.WriteLine("Speed compared to: " + TestSpeedReferenceSystem);
6583  Console.WriteLine("Average time: " + averageTime + " s. ");
6584  Console.WriteLine("Speed factor: " + TestSpeedReferenceTime / averageTime);
6585  Console.WriteLine();
6586  return null;
6587  }
